drupalNodeEvent.title: Taiwan Entangled in the Global Economy: Silicon, Supply Chains, Geopolitics

field_speakers.processed: William Kirby (Professor, Harvard University), Ken Sun (General Manager (Taiwan), Microsoft), Cindy Wang (Breaking News Editor, Bloomberg)

field_organizers.processed: The University of Washington Taiwan Studies Program, the University of Washington East Asia Center, and the University of Washington Foster School of Business Global Business Center

field_description.processed: In the backdrop of disruptions to international supply chains and national economies from the COVID-19 pandemic, Taiwan’s economic growth and success stand in stark contrast. As Taiwan’s economy thrives, led by its superlative response to the COVID-19 pandemic and the success of firms like TSMC, how does Taiwan’s involvement in the global economy change? Meanwhile, heightened hostility in US-China relations looms large, and the United States seeks to address security vulnerabilities in its exposure to Taiwanese semiconductors. How do Taiwan’s businesses navigate greater US-China-Taiwan geopolitical forces? This panel invites three experts from academia, journalism, and industry to discuss Taiwan’s business landscape during a turbulent pandemic world and the post-pandemic future.
